message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the classification of matter and living organisms. An organism is a source of biotic matter because it is a living entity that is composed of organic materials. Option (B) is incorrect because inanimate matter refers to non-living things. Option (C) is incorrect because dead matter refers to the remains of once-living organisms. Option (D) is incorrect because it refers to live action, which is not directly related to the classification of matter.

This question requires basic knowledge about the classification of matter. An organism is a living entity, so it is a source of biotic matter. Biotic matter refers to living or organic matter. Option (B) is incorrect because inanimate matter refers to non-living or non-organic matter. Option (C) is incorrect because dead matter refers to the remains of organisms after death, not the organism itself. Option (D) is incorrect because "live action" refers to a type of film or television production, not a classification of matter.

Biotic matter refers to matter that is associated with living organisms, such as cells, tissues, and organic molecules. Option (D) is incorrect because live action refers to the filming of real-life events, not the matter associated with organisms.
